thread.title: Wayne Rooney to Arsenal: Manchester United captain backed for sensational move
thread.title_full: Wayne Rooney to Arsenal: Manchester United captain backed for sensational move

title: Wayne Rooney to Arsenal: Manchester United captain backed for sensational move
text:
Wayne Rooney to Arsenal: Manchester United captain backed for sensational move HARRY REDKNAPP believes Arsene Wenger should consider a move for Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney. PUBLISHED: 10:57, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 11:08, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 
Rooney has been heavily linked with a big-money move to the Chinese Super League in recent weeks after falling out of favour under Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho. 
But Redknapp believes the 31-year-old could still do a job at Premier League rivals Arsenal . 
The former Tottenham boss says Rooney is the perfect player for Wenger, claiming the Arsenal manager is crying out for a leader. GETTY Harry Redknapp says Arsene Wenger needs a leader like Wayne Rooney GETTY Wayne Rooney has been linked with Manchester United exit 
Redknapp told the Evening Standard : "Arsenal looked at him a few years ago so we know Arsene is a fan. 
"He would improve that team overnight because they have an issue with attitude and he is a winner. 
"I watched Arsenal the other night at Sutton and I know it was a difficult pitch but some of their younger players were getting caught in possession, losing it cheaply and were putting their team in danger. 
"There was nobody there shouting: “Oi, f***ing liven up!” They get away with it all the time. Arsenal FC Super Quiz: Part 2 Superstar strikers who could replace Wayne Rooney at Man United Tue, February 21, 2017
